results.title: Jettison
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Adrian Rose
results.brief_description: Abstract shapes, distorted figures jettison on and off the screen metamorphosing to the rhythmic beat of “The Deadly art of knowledge” by Chris MacKellar. A vibrant celebration of the potential of animated forms to constantly move, change and surprise. Obtained an Honourable Mention in the Australian Panorama section of Australian International Animation Festival

results.title: Jets and rockets: how they work
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of jet engine propulsion by establishing Newton’s principle of action and reaction, and the principle of imbalance of forces. Discusses the varius types of fuel requirements for rockets.
results.description: Explains the principles of jet engine propulsion by establishing Newton’s principle of action and reaction, and the principle of imbalance of forces. Discusses the varius types of fuel requirements for rockets.

results.title: Jetobatics
results.brief_description: We meet the four Royal New Zealand Air Force pilots who form New Zealand’s team of jet plane aerobats and travel in their Vampire jet aircraft while they give a magnificent display of high speed aerobatics and smoke pattern making in the sky.
results.description: We meet the four Royal New Zealand Air Force pilots who form New Zealand’s team of jet plane aerobats and travel in their Vampire jet aircraft while they give a magnificent display of high speed aerobatics and smoke pattern making in the sky.

results.title: Jetflight
results.brief_description: Jetflight is the story of the Trans-Pacific delivery flight of the new Boeing 707 jet airliner. The film shows the great power and size of this luxury air giant on the trip from San Francisco to Melbourne. On stops at the islands of Hawaii and Fiji, it is welcomed by the local people. Once again the airliner takes off on the old Southern Cross route. On arrival at Sydney, the jet has completed its trip in 16 hours cutting by half the usual flying time. Narrated by Martin Royal, script by Ivan Chapman, photography by Bert Nicholas.

results.title: Jet propulsion
results.brief_description: The film discusses the advances in aviation since the days of the Wright brothers and explains that the piston operated power unit imposes limits on the altitudes and speeds at which aircraft can fly. The basic principles of jet propulsion are outlined and the operation of a jet engine explained by means of animated diagrams. The advantages and disadvantages of jet engines are listed and different types of jet propulsion illustrated.

results.title: Jet pilot
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Joseph Koenig
results.brief_description: A film showing how the introduction of jet travel changed traditional ideas of space and time. The jet pilot in this film sped from northern cold to tropical heat in only a few hours. The film is a dramatic illustration of how high speed-travel shrinks the world and brings people together. An Air Canada plane is featured. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: Jet boats in New Zealand
results.brief_description: Jet boats found in various parts of New Zealand. A New Zealand inventor demonstrates his jet boats on the beautiful lake, Manapouri; water skiers skim behind jet boats in Lyttelton Harbour; the twin jet ‘Rangimarie’ takes tourists up the Wanganui River and jet-boaters shoot the rapids and shallows of the Waimakariri River.

results.title: Jesus of Nazareth
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description: This is a special catechetical edition of Zeffirelli’s film, divided into 14 distinct parts, running for a total time of 7 hours. Starring Robert Powell as Jesus Christ, Peter Ustinov as Herod, Olivia Hussey as the Virgin Mary, Michael York as John the Baptist, Anne Bancroft as Mary Magdelene, and James Farentino as the Apostle Peter, this is the tale of the life and death of Jesus Christ, from the time of his birth until his crucifixion.

results.title: Jesus of Nazareth
results.creator_credit: ITC, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Vincenzo Labella and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: Director Franco Zeffirelli’s powerful and compelling epic traces the life of Jesus of Nazareth from Immaculate Conception through to Divine Resurrection. Critically acclaimed and lauded by religious leaders worldwide, a distinguished cast supports Robert Powell and Olivia Hussey in the leading roles of Jesus and Mary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ITC, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Vincenzo Labella and Franco Zeffirelli

results.title: Jesus of Montreal
results.creator_credit: Max Films, ONF | NFB, Roger Frappier, Pierre Gendron and Denys Arcand
results.brief_description: Daniel is a young actor who, like most of his friends, flits from commercials to stage to television trying to find work. Asked to take on a production of the Passion for a local Church, he finds himself increasingly obsessed with the story of Jesus and his redemption on the Cross. Daniel and the young cast begin to create a retelling of the Passion which resonates with a contemporary audience. However, the radical reworking upsets both the Church and the commercial sponsors who are uncomfortable with the interpretation. “Jesus of Montreal” is a sublime and deeply spiritual film. It is to director Denys Arcand’s credit that he has not only made a film that is ravishing to look at and experience but one which is not afraid to ask the big, difficult questions about life, faith and meaning. Winner of the Jury Prize at the Cannes Film Festival. Winner of a Silver Bear at the Berlin Film Festival.
